title: Ticket #1987: missing procd pipes not handled well
description:
How to Produce Problem

Hard-kill master and start a new master before procd has exited. When the old procd finally exits, the pipes being used by the new procd get deleted. Now when the starter tries to use the procd, it fails. For example, a local universe job fails in the following way: 

ERROR "ProcD has failed" at line 608 in file /home/condor/execute/dir_19479/userdir/src/condor_utils/proc_family_proxy.cpp

The problem is not self-correcting. The starter will fail in this way until the schedd is restarted. Similar types of errors happen on the execute side.

To remedy the situation, the administrator must stop Condor and ensure that all processes (especially the procd) are gone before restarting Condor.
